title: Hope Foundation for Innovative Research Science and Technology
detailsOfAchievement: â€¢ Submitted 5 patent applications on bio-pesticide formulations in Chennai patent office. â€¢ Developed methods of organic vegetable seedlings production and trained hundreds of farmers in Karnataka. â€¢ Developed a protocol of organic liquid formulation of Trichoderma viride â€“ a biocontrol fungus. This formulation was evaluated in the farmers field conditions for the management of nematodes and pathogenic fungus attacking Tomato, brinjal, okra and banana. The results are very encouraging. The formulation was distributed to hundreds of farmers in villages around Kolar, Doddaballapur and Chamarajanagar â€¢ Standardized a method of production of organic formulation of Arbuscular Mycorrhizal Fungusâ€“ Glomus mosseae. â€¢ This information is very critical for up-scaling the technology of mass production of Am fungus. This formulation was tested for its efficacy as a bio-fertiliser and bio-pesticide on various vegetable crops. All these formulations are highly useful in the organic farming, intensive farming and also in sustainable farming of crops. â€¢ Most of the farmers are using chemical pesticides indiscriminately. This has very adverse effect of the agro-eco systems. Hence standardization of eco-friendly methods and sustainable organic farming methods are very important for reducing the cost of cultivations of crops, increasing the productivity on sustainable basis, reduction in the use of chemical pesticides and further chemical residues in the food products. â€¢ All these methods are very important because many people are suffering from various health problems and cancer is becoming such a serious problem among many Indians because of the food consumption laced with the heavy doses of chemical residues. Achievements in the project include generation of awareness among the farmers by conducting demonstrations on the use of bio-pesticides (for seed treatment, nursery bed treatment, Farm Yard Manure (FYM) and vermin-compost enrichment) bio-fertilizers and also crop specific micro-nutrient mixtures in the farming systems â€¢ Bio-pesticides such as Pseudomonas fluorescens, Trichoderma harzianum, Paecilomyces lilacinus , kg, bio-fertilizers like Azotobacter , Azospirillum, and Banana specific micronutrient mixture, were distributed to hundreds of S.C and S.T farmers. This is against the total project target of 1150 SC/ST farmers in the chamrajnagar district . â€¢ Undertook monitoring of the farmers of Chamrajnagar, who were distributed with bio-pesticides and bio-fertilizers and the impact on the cropping system. All the farmers used the bio-pesticides for enriching FYM and applied to the paddy nursery, banana, sugar cane, brinjal and tomato crops. â€¢ Installed a solar power generator in Chamarajanagar and because of this 70 people â€“ poorest of the poor got benefitted â€¢ Installed night soil based Bio-gas unit (geo membrane biogas plant) at Narayanpur, Chhattisgarh with a capacity of 9-12 kg per day bio-gas production capacity. â€¢ This bio-gas unit has met the fuel requirement of 80 tribal girl children of 5 years to 15 years old. â€¢ Also Installed a solar power generator in Narayanapur which is 80 tribal girl children and distributed solar lamps to 50 tribal families in Narayanapur, Chhattisgarh

title: Jagadguru Sri Shivarathreeshwara University
detailsOfAchievement: Jagadguru Sri Shivarathreeshwara University, also known as JSS University, is a deemed university located in Mysore, Karnataka. It was established in 2008 under Section 3 of the UGC Act 1956 and is part of JSS Mahavidyapeetha, which runs a variety of educational institutions. Under the leadership and gracious Patronage and blessings of His Holiness Jagadguru Sri Shivarathri Deshikendra Mahaswamiji , the Chancellor of JSS University and Vice Chancellor, Dr.B. Suresh, a noted multifaceted leader in India, this deemed-to-be university is recognized by both MHRD and NAAC at A Grade, has been focusing more on teaching, research and service, from its inception. Teaching: JSS University is focused on medical and health-related studies, and comprises JSS Medical College, JSS Dental College, JSS College of Pharmacy, the Department of Water and Health, Department of Health System Management Studies and Department of Life Sciences. Thus, JSS University cater Medical, Dental and Pharmacy professionals with knowledge, skills and competencies at global standards with imbibed core values of respect, professionalism, leadership and social responsibilities to meet the health care needs of mankind. Renowned as a destination of learning, research and service the reputation of JSS University has become synonymous with quality education in India and abroad. Research: University has a sharp focus on attracting the best researchers and research students, and on providing them with comprehensive support and motivation. The University combines leading medical research and compassionate patient care to face the worldâ€™s most pressing medical challenges. Extensive research studies are being carried out which have a wide ranging impact in the area of management of various communicable and non-communicable diseases. Some of the work done are around, Cancer Stem Cells, Cancer Drug Discovery and Pharmacogenomics, Identification of therapeutic targets, Diabetes Mellitus, cardiovascular diseases, and many more. The research outputs have supported high impact publication in premier scientific journals and have contributed new knowledge to the understanding of newer drugs, therapy and treatment through innovations and patent. Service: JSS Hospital is one of the Indiaâ€™s biggest hospitals (1800 beds) catering to the health care needs of Mysore and the surrounding population. It is a non-profit hospital and is dedicated to serve the poor and downtrodden with affordable and quality healthcare. The motto of the hospital is to uphold the value of human life and provide advanced and affordable healthcare to all sections of the society. Achievements: JSS University is recognized by national and international agencies. Currently the University is recognized by (a) MHRD (is a ranking system not a grading system, Provide year of ranking) and NAAC at A Grade; (b) Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE), USA certification for Pharm-D program; and (c) National Board of Accreditation (NBA, NABL) and ISO-9001:2008. Other notable recognitions include: (a) TIFAC-CORE in herbal drugs approved by DST; (b) BA/BE center approved by DCGI; (c) Drug Testing Laboratory approved by State Government; (d) Faculty Training Centre, Industry Institution Interaction Cell, Entrepreneurship Cell approved by AICTE; and (e) Centre for Advanced Drug Research and Testing (CADRAT) approved by Drug Controller General of India

title: JAN SHIKSHAN SANSTHAN SHIMOGA

members.name: S. Y. Aruna Devi Y ARUNA DEVI

detailsOfAchievement: JAN SHIKSHAN SANSTHAN, Shimoga has covered Seven Taluks and has benefited around 60000 beneficiaries through its various vocational skill training and Life Enrichment Education programmes in a span of 15 years. The beneficiaries include men and women, illiterates, neo literates, SC STs Minorities, Widows, Physically challenged and economically oppressed classes of the society of Shimoga District. JSS has bagged a record number of awards for its outstanding work in the field of skill development, some of which are 1. State Literacy Award 2004 2. State Literacy Award 2007 3. Lakshmi N Menon Award for outstanding achievement in Womens Literacy Programme 2008 4. NLMA UNESCO Award 2010 5. JSS, Shimoga has secured 88.50 % in the External Evaluation conducted by Indian Institute of Management Bangalore. 6. The National Literacy Mission Authority has appointed Smt S.Y.Arunadevi, Director, JSS as the Executive Member from June 2010 to 2012. Activities are important to generate awareness among the beneficiaries and the community in which Shimoga JSS has organized a number of activities on the occasion of World Health Day, World Environment Day, World Population Day, International Literacy day etc On these occasions the JSS have organized different activities like medical camps, awareness, exhibitions, Skits, Rallies, etc throughout the district in which the State Government officers, medical experts and educationists have participated. Apart from traditional employable courses, the JSS organizes some nontraditional courses also which have given the beneficiaries more economic benefits. They include Dollu Kunitha, Saloon Maintenance, Women Security Guard, Yakshagana Folk Art etc For example DOLLU KUNITHA a folk drum dance which used to be traditionally done by men as the dancers has to carry heavy drums. JSS has trained women group for this dance which has been widely appreciated. This group also travels all over the state and charge between Rs.15,000 to Rs 20,000 per programme. This group has got Vishwa Chethana, Mayura and Karnataka Bhushana Awards. Teaching learning materials In all the training programmes organized by the JSS, the curriculum has been prepared with the help of resource persons. The curriculum is a blend of the standardized curriculum of DAE and the local needs. The JSS has prepared teaching learning materials for a number of vocational courses. This important step helps for strengthening the knowledge of persons undergoing training. As part of Literacy linked vocational education, the JSS separately prepared PRIMERS for 25 courses through which basic literacy is imparted to nonliterate beneficiaries Karnataka Open School In order to encourage continuing education, particularly for females, coaching classes are organized for the economically poor discontinued students to enable them to sit for 10 standard examination conducted by KOS.
